verses.verse: He made <WH6213> the altar <WH4196> of burnt offering <WH5930> of acacia <WH7848> wood. <WH6086> It was square. <WH7251> Its length <WH753> was five <WH2568> cubits, <WH520> its breadth <WH7341> was five <WH2568> cubits, <WH520> and its height <WH6967> was three <WH7969> cubits. <WH520>
He made <WH6213> its horns <WH7161> on its four <WH702> corners. <WH6438> Its horns <WH7161> were of one piece with it, <WH6823> and he overlaid it with brass. <WH5178>

He made <WH6213> all the vessels <WH3627> of the altar, <WH4196> the pots, <WH5518> the shovels, <WH3257> the basins, <WH4219> the forks, <WH4207> and the fire pans. <WH4289> He made <WH6213> all its vessels <WH3627> of brass. <WH5178>
He made <WH6213> for the altar <WH4196> a grating <WH4345> of a network <WH7568> of brass, <WH5178> under the ledge around <WH3749> it beneath, <WH4295> reaching halfway up. <WH2677>
He cast <WH3332> four <WH702> rings <WH2885> for the four <WH702> ends <WH7099> of brass <WH5178> grating, <WH4345> to be places <WH1004> for the poles. <WH905>
He made <WH6213> the poles <WH905> of acacia <WH7848> wood, <WH6086> and overlaid <WH6823> them with brass. <WH5178>
He put <WH935> the poles <WH905> into the rings <WH2885> on the sides <WH6763> of the altar, <WH4196> with which to carry <WH5375> it. <WH6213> He made it hollow <WH5014> with planks. <WH3871>

He made <WH6213> the basin <WH3595> of brass, <WH5178> and its base <WH3653> of brass, <WH5178> out of the mirrors <WH4759> of the ministering <WH6633> women who ministered <WH6633> at the door <WH6607> of the Tent <WH168> of Meeting. <WH4150>

He made <WH6213> the court: <WH2691> for the south <WH5045> side <WH6285> southward <WH8486> the hangings <WH7050> of the court <WH2691> were of fine twined <WH7806> linen, <WH8336> one hundred <WH3967> cubits; <WH520>

their pillars <WH5982> were twenty, <WH6242> and their sockets <WH134> twenty, <WH6242> of brass; <WH5178> the hooks <WH2053> of the pillars <WH5982> and their fillets <WH2838> were of silver. <WH3701>

For the north <WH6828> side <WH6285> one hundred <WH3967> cubits, <WH520> their pillars <WH5982> twenty, <WH6242> and their sockets <WH134> twenty, <WH6242> of brass; <WH5178> the hooks <WH2053> of the pillars, <WH5982> and their fillets, <WH2838> of silver. <WH3701>

For the west <WH3220> side <WH6285> were hangings <WH7050> of fifty <WH2572> cubits, <WH520> their pillars <WH5982> ten, <WH6235> and their sockets <WH134> ten; <WH6235> the hooks <WH2053> of the pillars, <WH5982> and their fillets, <WH2838> of silver. <WH3701>
For the east <WH6924> side <WH6285> eastward <WH4217> fifty <WH2572> cubits. <WH520>
The hangings <WH7050> for the one side <WH3802> were fifteen <WH2568> cubits; <WH520> their pillars <WH5982> three, <WH7969> and their sockets <WH134> three; <WH7969>

and so for the other <WH8145> side: <WH3802> on this hand and that hand by the gate <WH8179> of the court <WH2691> were hangings <WH7050> of fifteen <WH2568> cubits; <WH520> their pillars <WH5982> three, <WH7969> and their sockets <WH134> three. <WH7969>
All the hangings <WH7050> around <WH5439> the court <WH2691> were of fine twined <WH7806> linen. <WH8336>

The sockets <WH134> for the pillars <WH5982> were of brass. <WH5178> The hooks <WH2053> of the pillars <WH5982> and their fillets <WH2838> were of silver; <WH3701> and the overlaying <WH6826> of their capitals, <WH7218> of silver; <WH3701> and all the pillars <WH5982> of the court <WH2691> were filleted <WH2836> with silver. <WH3701>

The screen <WH4539> for the gate <WH8179> of the court <WH2691> was the work of the embroiderer, <WH7551> of blue, <WH8504> purple, <WH713> scarlet, <WH8144> and fine twined <WH7806> linen. <WH8336> Twenty <WH6242> cubits <WH520> was the length, <WH753> and the height <WH6967> in the breadth <WH7341> was five <WH2568> cubits, <WH520> like <WH5980> to the hangings <WH7050> of the court. <WH2691>

Their pillars <WH5982> were four, <WH702> and their sockets <WH134> four, <WH702> of brass; <WH5178> their hooks <WH2053> of silver, <WH3701> and the overlaying <WH6826> of their capitals, <WH7218> and their fillets, <WH2838> of silver. <WH3701>
All the pins <WH3489> of the tabernacle, <WH4908> and around <WH5439> the court, <WH2691> were of brass. <WH5178>

This <WH428> is the amount <WH6485> of material used for the tabernacle, <WH4908> even the Tabernacle <WH4908> of the Testimony, <WH5715> as they were counted, <WH6485> according to the commandment <WH6310> of Moses, <WH4872> for the service <WH5656> of the Levites, <WH3881> by the hand <WH3027> of Ithamar, <WH385> the son <WH1121> of Aaron <WH175> the priest. <WH3548>
Bezalel <WH1212> the son <WH1121> of Uri, <WH221> the son <WH1121> of Hur, <WH2354> of the tribe <WH4294> of Judah, <WH3063> made <WH6213> all that Yahweh <WH3068> commanded <WH6680> Moses. <WH4872>

With him was Oholiab, <WH171> the son <WH1121> of Ahisamach, <WH294> of the tribe <WH4294> of Dan, <WH1835> an engraver, <WH2796> and a skillful workman, <WH2803> and an embroiderer <WH7551> in blue, <WH8504> in purple, <WH713> in scarlet, <WH8144> and in fine linen. <WH8336>

All the gold <WH2091> that was used <WH6213> for the work <WH4399> in all the work <WH4399> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> even the gold <WH2091> of the offering, <WH8573> was twenty <WH6242> nine <WH8672> talents, <WH3603> and seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> thirty <WH7970> shekels, <WH8255> after the shekel <WH8255> of the sanctuary. <WH6944>

The silver <WH3701> of those who were numbered <WH6485> of the congregation <WH5712> was one hundred <WH3967> talents, <WH3603> and one thousand <WH505> seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> seventy five <WH7657> shekels, <WH8255> after the shekel <WH8255> of the sanctuary: <WH6944>

a beka <WH1235> a head, <WH1538> that is, <WH4276> half a shekel, <WH8255> after the shekel <WH8255> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> for everyone who passed <WH5674> over to those who were numbered, <WH6485> from twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> and upward, <WH4605> for six <WH8337> hundred <WH3967> three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> five <WH2568> hundred <WH3967> fifty men. <WH2572>

The one hundred <WH3967> talents <WH3603> of silver <WH3701> were for casting <WH3332> the sockets <WH134> of the sanctuary, <WH6944> and the sockets <WH134> of the veil; <WH6532> one hundred <WH3967> sockets <WH134> for the one hundred <WH3967> talents, <WH3603> a talent <WH3603> for a socket. <WH134>

Of the one thousand <WH505> seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> seventy <WH7657> five <WH2568> shekels he made <WH6213> hooks <WH2053> for the pillars, <WH5982> overlaid <WH6823> their capitals, <WH7218> and made fillets for them. <WH2836>
The brass <WH5178> of the offering <WH8573> was seventy <WH7657> talents, <WH3603> and two thousand <WH505> four <WH702> hundred <WH3967> shekels. <WH8255>

With this he made <WH6213> the sockets <WH134> to the door <WH6607> of the Tent <WH168> of Meeting, <WH4150> the bronze <WH5178> altar, <WH4196> the bronze <WH5178> grating <WH4345> for it, <WH3627> all the vessels of the altar, <WH4196>

the sockets <WH134> around <WH5439> the court, <WH2691> the sockets <WH134> of the gate <WH8179> of the court, <WH2691> all the pins <WH3489> of the tabernacle, <WH4908> and all the pins <WH3489> around <WH5439> the court. <WH2691>
